content.raw:
Now that we can submit multiple log files, I was preparing a qual2 file and found that the sampled and filtered file:

```
#!python

gz log -e -f state.log --filter *.pose/*.pose -z 10 > qual_2.log
```
has a score with a longer time than the unfiltered file:


```
#!python

gz log -e -f state.log > qual2.log
```
Can we submit the unfiltered log?  For that matter, is it OK to submit our original state.log file, just as a backup in case something goes wonky with the filtering and/or compression? The files are big, but they are not huge.  Also, I think it is important to get a file that has more than just the pose data.  I have seen some oddball results in the pose data where it looks like the task was completed when it was not.  You may want to verify the top 20 results by looking at the full gazebo log.
content.html:
Now that we can submit multiple log files, I was preparing a qual2 file and found that the sampled and filtered file:

gz log -e -f state.log --filter *.pose/*.pose -z 10 > qual_2.log

has a score with a longer time than the unfiltered file:

gz log -e -f state.log > qual2.log

Can we submit the unfiltered log? For that matter, is it OK to submit our original state.log file, just as a backup in case something goes wonky with the filtering and/or compression? The files are big, but they are not huge. Also, I think it is important to get a file that has more than just the pose data. I have seen some oddball results in the pose data where it looks like the task was completed when it was not. You may want to verify the top 20 results by looking at the full gazebo log.
